properties.description: properties are public to all roles involved in the request, the very basic elements.

request_id.description: generated by server when the /api/request/new is called

requestor_id.description: receive from requestor when /api/request/new is called. For the client side, this id will be automatically obtained from requstor's profile (might need anouther api for user management).

request_type.description: receive from requestor when the /api/request/new is called

request_start_time.description: receive from requestor when the /api/request/new is called

request_finish_time.description: Initiated as None, and receive from the LAST provider when /api/request/complete is called.

status.description: generated by server when the /api/request/new is called, the first status is pending {P1} acceptance

process_flow.description: static array of a series of department. generated according to the <request_type>

contents.description: Have {len(process_flow) + 1} items. Contents[0]->identity = requestor. Store information provided by requestor/any provider.

content.description: Arguments varies for different role. See <api_aws.json>line 34-39 as an example

chat.?: do we want to store chat history?
